subject: Science
title: Can We Control the Weather?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Can We Control the Weather?.

hook.text: Humans have tried to control weather since the 1940s. Results have been mixed.

buildup.text: Cloud seeding injects silver iodide into clouds to encourage rain or snow.

discovery.text: China used cloud seeding to ensure clear skies for the 2008 Olympics opening ceremony.

twist.text: Evidence that cloud seeding actually works consistently is surprisingly weak.

climax.text: Some scientists propose geoengineering â€” reflecting sunlight to cool the planet.

punchline.text: We can barely predict weather. Controlling it is another level entirely.
